content.question: A statistician at a metal manufacturing plant is sampling the thickness of metal plates. If an outlier occurs within a particular sample, the statistician must check the configuration of the machine. The distribution of metal thickness has mean 23.5 millimeters <math alttext="m m" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>(mm)</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> and standard deviation 1.4 <math alttext="millimeter" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>mm</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>. Based on the two-standard deviations rule for outliers, of the following, which is the greatest thickness that would require the statistician to check the configuration of the machine?

topic.text: 1.7: Summary Statistics for a Quantitative Variable

skill.text: Skill 4.B: Interpret statistical calculations and findings to assign meaning or assess a claim.
